snippet: Apple has sold out of the iPad inventory it allotted for pre-orders and the company's Web site is now saying that every model of the new iPad will ship to customers in two to three weeks. It will begin selling the new iPad in retail stores startin...
abstract: Apple has sold out of the iPad inventory it allotted for pre-orders and the company's Web site is now saying that every model of the new iPad will ship to customers in two to three weeks. It will begin selling the new iPad in retail stores starting Friday.

headline.main: The New iPad Is Already Scarce

snippet: Intel has held preliminary talks with entertainment companies recently about creating a service for accessing television shows over the Internet. The chip maker envisions the service as a bundle of television channels akin to the packages of conte...
abstract: Intel has held preliminary talks with entertainment companies recently about creating a service for accessing television shows over the Internet. The chip maker envisions the service as a bundle of television channels akin to the packages of content that consumers currently get from cable and satellite television providers.

headline.main: Intel Talking to Networks About Internet TV Service

snippet: Corrections appearing in print on March 13, 2012.
Felix Investments and SharesPost are expected to face the first legal actions taken by the agency since it started its investigation into the trading of shares in privately held companies.
abstract: Felix Investments and SharesPost are expected to face the first legal actions taken by the agency since it started its investigation into the trading of shares in privately held companies.

headline.main: S.E.C. Close to Bringing Cases on 2 Brokerage Firms
headline.print_headline: S.E.C. Query Closes In On 2 Brokerage Firms

byline.original: By PETER LATTMAN and EVELYN M. RUSLI

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar news. Monday's selections include suggested guidelines for making iPad apps for children, a talk with the top designer at Apple and a turnaround pr...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar news. Monday's selections include suggested guidelines for making iPad apps for children, a talk with the top designer at Apple and a turnaround progress report from Cisco Systems' chief executive.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Twitter Acquires Posterous, and Facebook Bigamy Case

snippet: After Apple's introduction last week of the new iPad, which is compatible with the faster fourth-generation LTE network, AT&T has been rebranding parts of its current network "4G" -- apparently so it can say it has the biggest 4G network in the Un...
abstract: After Apple's introduction last week of the new iPad, which is compatible with the faster fourth-generation LTE network, AT&T has been rebranding parts of its current network "4G" -- apparently so it can say it has the biggest 4G network in the United States. But at least one analyst thinks that despite this effort, Verizon, not AT&T, will win most of the new iPad customers with its greater network coverage.

headline.main: With the New iPad, New Questions Over the Meaning of 4G

snippet: Last week's App Smart column featured apps for singers and aspiring vocalists. People who can't get enough of these apps should also look at Voice Tutor and StarMaker: Karaoke + Auto-Tune.
abstract: Last week's App Smart column featured apps for singers and aspiring vocalists. People who can't get enough of these apps should also look at Voice Tutor and StarMaker: Karaoke + Auto-Tune.

headline.main: App Smart Extra: More Singing Apps

snippet: Trying to entice travelers in their 20s to mid-30s, the fastest-growing age segment, many owners and operators are remodeling existing hotels or introducing new ones.
abstract: Many hotel owners and operators, trying to entice the fastest-growing age segment, travelers in their 20s to mid-30s, are remodeling existing hotels or introducing new ones; many of the technology- and social media-obsessed Millennials seek innovative attractions, including free Wi-Fi and stylish bars.

snippet: China reported its biggest trade deficit in at least 22 years, and investors paused to consider the impact of a slowing Chinese economy.
abstract: Stocks are mixed in light trading as investors pause to consider the impact of a slowing Chinese economy.

headline.main: Slowdown in China Weighs on Wall St.
headline.print_headline: Slowdown in China Weighs on Wall St.

snippet: Some small video game makers say the line between inspiration and shameless copying seems to have all but disappeared.
abstract: Some small video game makers say the line between inspiration and shameless copying seems to have all but disappeared; some larger app makers and online gaming developers like Zynga are cloning smaller game makers' creations; developers say they have little recourse for their stolen ideas, since the mechanics of a game cannot be copyrighted.

headline.main: For Creators of Games, a Faint Line on Cloning
headline.print_headline: For Creators Of Games, A Faint Line On Cloning
